oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: WSM Variety Award Presentation - 1949-06-01 - Part 3
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: WSM program aimed at George Rosen of Variety magazine to celebrate winning the 1948 Variety Award for 'How To Run A Radio Station'. Part three of four, this part concludes the section on public service programs and covers the Grand Ole Opry.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Red Foley; Roy Acuff; Minnie Pearl; Uncle Dave Macon; Lonzo & Oscar; Cowboy Copas
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Announcer talks about Eurico Gaspar Dutra's visit to Tennessee -- Excerpt from Eurico Gaspar Dutra's visit to Tennessee coverage -- Announcer talks about WSM programs -- Tennessee Saturday Night (excerpt) (Red Foley) -- Announcer talks about WSM -- Tennessee Saturday Night (excerpt) (Red Foley) -- Announcer talks -- Tennessee Saturday Night (excerpt) (Red Foley) -- Announcer talks about the Grand Ole Opry -- First broadcast of the Grand Ole Opry (reenactment) -- Announcer talks about George D. Hay and the Opry -- Great Speckled Bird (excerpt) (Roy Acuff) -- Announcer talks about Roy Acuff -- Outline of the Grand Ole Opry -- Walking The Floor Over You (excerpt) (Ernest Tubb) -- Announcer talks about Ernest Tubb -- Comedy routine (excerpt) (Minnie Pearl) -- Announcer talks about Opry stars in movies -- Report on Grand Ole Opry movie -- Announcer introduces Uncle Dave Macon -- Two-In-One Chewing Gum (excerpt) (Uncle Dave Macon) -- Announcer talks -- I'm My Own Grandpa (excerpt) (Lonzo & Oscar) -- Announcer talks -- Filipino Baby (excerpt) (Cowboy Copas)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); Dutra, Eurico Gaspar, 1883-1974; Your capitol reporter (Radio program); Grand ole opry (Radio program); Acuff, Roy; Tubb, Ernest, 1914-1984; Minnie Pearl; Foley, Red, 1910-1968; Copas, Cowboy; Lonzo and Oscar
